feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Business Technology Platform
feed.subtitle: SAP Business Technology Platform Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: SAP HANA Cloud Free Tier shows “instance already exists” but no instance is visible
entry.content:
We are working in a Pay-As-You-Go SAP BTP partner account and initially created a test SAP CAP application connected to an SAP HANA Cloud database. After deleting this setup to start fresh, we encountered an HDI container–related error while creating a new CAP application. When checking the HANA Cloud section, no database instance was visible, but attempts to create a new HANA Cloud instance consistently fail with an error indicating that an instance already exists. We tried deleting and recreating the HANA Cloud service and even removed the entire subaccount, but the same error persists, suggesting a previously provisioned HANA instance is stuck or orphaned and still consuming quota, blocking further database setup.

Error:  BrokerError, Description: You may only create one SAP HANA Cloud Free Tier instance

Main Issue

While setting up a fresh SAP CAP application, I encountered an HDI container error. When checking SAP HANA Cloud, I noticed that no HANA Cloud instance was visible, even though the system behaves as if one already exists.

What I Tried (and Failed)

  • Create a new SAP HANA Cloud instance
    → Failed with an error stating that only one instance is allowed (instance already exists)

  • Delete the HANA Cloud database and recreate everything
    → Failed (same error persists)

  • Delete the entire SAP BTP subaccount and recreate everything
    → Failed (same error still occurs)

Current Situation

It appears that an existing or orphaned HANA Cloud instance is still consuming quota, even though it is not visible or accessible, which is blocking further database setup and CAP development.

 

I would appreciate any guidance on how to clean up or reset this stuck SAP HANA Cloud instance so that we can proceed with database setup and continue CAP development.

entry.title: MDI to Planon Integration delta token not matching
entry.content:
We've recently established connection with Planon with S4 HANA Public Cloud. We've managed to push/pull some data.

Then I've tried to set up the BP resulting to recreating the MDI service instance.

After updating the credentials of impacted config, we can no longer sync to Planon. Planon says they are getting a delta token not matching error. They already tried restarting their app but still no go.

2025-12-10 17:23:48,100 [ERROR] [pnlog.APP.planonsoftware.com.planonrealestatemanagementforsap.servermodule.com.planon.sap.scheduledtask.SyncVersionIdsTask] Exception occured while executing SyncVersionIdsTask: SyncService-BTP response Code: 400, message: {"error":{"code":"DeltaTokenDoesNotMatchRequest","message":"The consuming system or requested entity type and version does not match the delta token. Please only use delta tokens in the context of one consuming system, entity type and version.","details":[]}} : com.planonsoftware.platform.backend.connector.v2.MessageDiscardException: SyncService-BTP response Code: 400, message: {"error":{"code":"DeltaTokenDoesNotMatchRequest","message":"The consuming system or requested entity type and version does not match the delta token. Please only use delta tokens in the context of one consuming system, entity type and version.","details":[]}}

What can we do with this issue?

entry.title: Very Small Click Area for Hierarchy Extension Navigation in SAP Service & Asset Manager 2405
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

We are facing an issue in SAP Service & Asset Manager 2405, using the standard iOS client downloaded from the App Store.

In the Hierarchy Extension views, when we click on the expand/collapse or child-navigation icon, the touch area is extremely small. If the user does not tap exactly on that tiny icon, the app opens the details screen of the list item instead of navigating to the child hierarchy.

This creates usability issues because the correct tap zone is too small on iOS.

Is there any way to increase the clickable/touch area of the hierarchy icon in MDK?

We are using:

   SAP Service & Asset Manager 2405

    iOS device

   Standard client (no custom client)

Please see the attached screen.png file

Best Regards,

Divan Wellalage

entry.title: SPF Failure When Sending Emails from BTP BPA and Integration Suite
entry.content:
I am encountering the following SPF failures when SAP BTP Build Process Automation and Integration Suite attempt to send emails using the rmsinc.com domain:

  • Fail (protection.outlook.com: domain of rmsinc.com does not designate 54.162.233.194 as a permitted sender)

  • Fail (protection.outlook.com: domain of rmsinc.com does not designate 52.23.123.125 as a permitted sender)

It appears that these IP addresses are not included in the current SPF record of rmsinc.com.

Question:
Where can I find the complete list of IP addresses that must be added to the rmsinc.com SPF record to allow outgoing emails from SAP BTP (BPA and Integration Suite)?

Thank you in advanc

entry.title: Bachelor Thesis Topic Suggestions on SAP BTP (Wirtschaftsinformatik Student)
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I am a Bachelor student in Wirtschaftsinformatik (Business Informatics) in Germany and I am currently looking for a suitable topic for my Bachelor thesis related to SAP BTP.

I already have some practical experience with SAP, especially:
- ABAP development
- SAP IS-U (energy industry context)
- Basic understanding of SAP system architecture

For my Bachelor thesis, I would like to choose a topic that:
- Is suitable for a Bachelor level (not too complex or research-heavy)
- Has a practical and application-oriented focus
- Helps me better understand SAP BTP and its role in modern SAP landscapes

At the moment, I am considering topics such as:
- SAP BTP as an extension platform for existing SAP systems
- Comparison between traditional ABAP development and ABAP Cloud on SAP BTP
- The role of SAP BTP in digital transformation, especially in the energy industry

I would highly appreciate any suggestions, feedback, or ideas for Bachelor thesis topics related to SAP BTP that fit my background.

Thank you very much in advance for your support!

Best regards
Yisen

entry.title: CAP Multitenancy: Connectivity Service returns 401 invalid_client despite correct provisioning setup
entry.content:
I’m working on a CAP multitenant app in Cloud Foundry and I keep getting a 401 error when trying to use the Connectivity service, even though I’ve added it as a dependency both in my mta.yaml and in the provisioning dependencies handler. 
What makes this confusing is: I can successfully read subscriber destinations, but Connectivity fails even though it is also bound.

In my app:

  • Connectivity is listed as a dependency in mta.yaml
  • I return both the destination and connectivity xsappname in the dependencies handler
  • The xsappname values look correct in my environment variables
  • I’ve redeployed and double-checked the service bindings

But I still get this error:

Error: Could not fetch client credentials token for service of type connectivity: HTTP response ... was 401: {"error":"invalid_client","error_description":"Bad credentials"}

Main package versions:
@SAP-cloud-sdk/connectivity: ^4.2.0
@SAP-cloud-sdk/http-client: ^4.2.0
@SAP/cds: ^9.5.2
@SAP/cds-mtxs: ^3.5.1
@SAP/xssec: ^4

I have already reviewed the following SAP Community post and the related blog comments, but unfortunately the suggested approach did not resolve the issue in my case:

https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-q-a/cap-multitenancy-connectivity/qaq-p/12493182

Has anyone else run into this? Is there something I might be missing?
Any tips would be really appreciated!

Thanks!

entry.content:

Please answer and clarify

Thanks in advance

entry.title: Cannot transport recreated API with same technical name after deletion (Cloud Transport Management)
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

In SAP Integration Suite / SAP BTP using Cloud Transport Management, we experienced the following behavior:

1. An API artifact (auto-generated from a custom CDS View) was created in DEV and transported successfully to STAGING.
2. The API was then deleted in DEV, and the deletion was transported to STAGING.
3. Later, the API was recreated in DEV using the same technical name, but assigned to a different scenario, and we attempted to transport it to STAGING.

However, the recreated API does not appear on the "Exporting a Software Collection" screen, so it cannot be transported to STAGING.

Questions:
1. Is this a known limitation or intended behavior that once an API artifact is deleted and the deletion is transported, the same technical name cannot be reused and transported again, even if it is assigned to a different scenario?
2. Is recreating the CDS View and API with a different technical name the only supported solution in this case?

Thank you in advance.

entry.title: SAP Business Application Studio Dev Space stuck in STARTING (Trial)
entry.content:
Hello,

I am using SAP BTP Trial and my Dev Space in SAP Business Application Studio
remains in STARTING state for more than 20–30 minutes.

I have tried:
- Stopping and restarting the Dev Space
- Deleting and recreating the Dev Space
- Creating a new Dev Space (Full Stack Cloud Application)

Still, the Dev Space never reaches RUNNING state.
Disk usage shows "Currently unavailable".

Is there a known issue or limitation with Trial infrastructure today?

Trial subaccount: 4745b435trial
Region: US10cf

Thanks in advance.

entry.title: Oracle EBS/Fusion to SAP S/4 Hana technical roadmap
entry.content: My organization is sunsetting Oracle EBS and moving to SAP S/4 Hana. If you were from EBS background earlier and had moved to SAP technical then can you please tell me what needed to be learn if I have to work as SAP technical?

entry.title: Roadmap to Become SAP BTP Platform Expert (From Fiori Dev/Admin) + Certification Exam Changes
entry.content:
Hello Community,

I am currently working as an SAP Fiori Developer and Fiori Administrator. My goal is to grow into a full SAP BTP Platform Expert who can own the platform end-to-end (administration, integration, extension, security, and architecture).

Could you please help with:

  1. A concise certification roadmap or PDF for becoming an SAP BTP Platform Expert (beyond Fiori Dev/Admin).

  2. Guidance on which skills and certifications are essential to move from Fiori focused roles to platform ownership.

  3. Any updates on certification exam changes from January especially whether exams will include practical / hands-on components in addition to MCQs.

Any official SAP links, blogs, or experience-based advice would be highly appreciated.

Thanks in advance.
Ashwin

entry.title: How can GenAI be effectively used in SAP S/4HANA implementation and support projects?
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I would like to understand how Generative AI (GenAI) can be practically applied within the SAP ecosystem, especially in S/4HANA implementation, migration, and support projects.

Specifically, I’m interested in insights on:

  • Using GenAI for requirements analysis and documentation

  • Automating test case creation and test data preparation

  • Supporting ABAP development, code review, and optimization

  • Enhancing functional consulting (FI, MM, SD, etc.) through AI-driven analysis

  • Improving incident management and ticket resolution in AMS/support scenarios

  • Any SAP-native tools or integrations (e.g., SAP Joule, SAP BTP + AI services)

I’d appreciate real-world examples, best practices, limitations to be aware of, and recommendations on where GenAI adds the most value in SAP projects.

Thank you in advance for sharing your experiences and suggestions.

Best regards,
Juveria

entry.title: SAP Service and Asset Manager 2405 - Take Reading : Decimal point issue
entry.content:
Dear Experts

We’ve encountered an issue with the SSAM 2405 mobile application. The problem is related to the 'take reading' feature under the functional location or workorder detail screen.

When users attempt to submit the bulk take reading page with decimal values (as a reading - i.e. 456,67) , the submission fails if a comma is used (region set as Denmark in device) and it works for UK region . However, this issue does not occur when readings are taken individually.

Could you please let us know if anyone else has encountered this issue and advise on how it can be resolved?

entry.content:
Dear expert,

i have 2 replication flow will retrieve data from 1 CDS ( for inbound and passthrough). When i see in DHCDCMON , i see 2 subscriber id but i don't know which subscriber for which replication flow.

Please suggest me to verify in this case.

Thank you for your help.

Best Regards,

new technician to use RF

entry.title: store credentials for destination in MTA file
entry.content:
Hello Experts

I am using the Destination service in SAP BTP, and the destination is consumed by an SAP CAP application (Node.js).

Currently, the destination is defined in mta.yaml, and for an on-premise system (via Cloud Connector) it requires BasicAuthentication.

I want to avoid hardcoding credentials (user/password) in mta.yaml.

What is the recommended and secure way to manage credentials for destinations used by CAP applications?

Any guidance or best practices for production scenarios would be appreciated.

- name: <name>-destination
  type: org.cloudfoundry.managed-service
  requires:
    - name: srv-api
  parameters:
    service: destination
    service-plan: lite
    config:
      HTML5Runtime_enabled: true
      init_data:
        instance:
          destinations:
            - Name: <name>-srv
              URL: ~{srv-api/srv-url}
              Authentication: NoAuthentication
              Type: HTTP
              ProxyType: Internet
              HTML5.ForwardAuthToken: true
              HTML5.DynamicDestination: true
              HTML5.Timeout: 600000

            - Name: ui5
              Authentication: NoAuthentication
              ProxyType: Internet
              Type: HTTP
              URL: https://ui5.sap.com

            - Name: S4_TECH
              URL: http://<ON_PREMISE_HOST>:<PORT>
              Type: HTTP
              ProxyType: OnPremise
              Authentication: BasicAuthentication
              User: "<TECH_USER>"
              Password: "<REDACTED>"
              sap-client: "<CLIENT>"
              CloudConnectorLocationId: "<LOCATION_ID>"
              Description: "Technical destination for nightly sync"
          existing_destinations_policy: update

entry.title: store credentials for destination in MTA file
entry.content:
Hello Experts

I am using the Destination service in SAP BTP, and the destination is consumed by an SAP CAP application (Node.js).

Currently, the destination is defined in mta.yaml, and for an on-premise system (via Cloud Connector) it requires BasicAuthentication.

I want to avoid hardcoding credentials (user/password) in mta.yaml.

What is the recommended and secure way to manage credentials for destinations used by CAP applications?

Any guidance or best practices for production scenarios would be appreciated.

- name: <name>-destination
  type: org.cloudfoundry.managed-service
  requires:
    - name: srv-api
  parameters:
    service: destination
    service-plan: lite
    config:
      HTML5Runtime_enabled: true
      init_data:
        instance:
          destinations:
            - Name: <name>-srv
              URL: ~{srv-api/srv-url}
              Authentication: NoAuthentication
              Type: HTTP
              ProxyType: Internet
              HTML5.ForwardAuthToken: true
              HTML5.DynamicDestination: true
              HTML5.Timeout: 600000

            - Name: ui5
              Authentication: NoAuthentication
              ProxyType: Internet
              Type: HTTP
              URL: https://ui5.sap.com

            - Name: S4_TECH
              URL: http://<ON_PREMISE_HOST>:<PORT>
              Type: HTTP
              ProxyType: OnPremise
              Authentication: BasicAuthentication
              User: "<TECH_USER>"
              Password: "<REDACTED>"
              sap-client: "<CLIENT>"
              CloudConnectorLocationId: "<LOCATION_ID>"
              Description: "Technical destination for nightly sync"
          existing_destinations_policy: update

entry.title: JSON Payload Download Implementation in RAP Application
entry.content:
Hello Expert,

I am currently working on a custom RAP (RESTful ABAP Programming Model) Application in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud. In this application, we use an API to send data to an external portal.

Now there is a new requirement when the user clicks a button, the JSON payload that is used in the ABAP program for sending data via the API should be downloaded in JSON format.

For this purpose, I have already created a custom action in the Behavior Definition, and the button is visible in the Application. My question is how to implement the download functionality so that the same JSON payload used for the API call can be downloaded by the user in JSON format and Also, please explain how to implement the JSON download functionality in the RAP application with step by step guidance.

Thank you,

entry.title: Combining apps from different Work Zone Content Providers/Packages in one CDM
entry.content:
Dear experts in this space and dear broader SAP community, 

I am trying to combine apps from different Work Zone Content Providers/Packages in one CDM (Common Data Model) definition of another Content Provider. Example - One Content Package/Provider is providing some cards/apps to my Work Zone tenant, and I would like to consume these cards/apps in a Work Space CDM definition of another Content Provider. 

Similar things can be done using the Work Zone Content Manager allowing to combine apps/cards from different Content Providers/Packages into one Work Page. Nevertheless, I couldn't figure out how to do this within a CDM definition. Prefixing the app ID with the other Content Provider ID (see below) did not do the job (e.g., content.provider_app.id). Any help or input is highly appreciated. 

My goal is to have a CDM, that contains a Work Page, that references apps from multiple other Content Packages/Providers. 

@matthias_schmalz @gregorw @jmargieh - Maybe you have already done something similar?

Thanks in advance and all the best, 
Martin

{
    "_version": "3.2.0",
    "identification": {
      "id": "combined-workpage",
      "entityType": "workpage",
      "title": "{{Title}}"
    },
    "payload": {
      "workpageConfig": {
        "title": "Combined Work Page"
      },
      "rows": [
        {
          "id": "row-1",
          "rowConfig": {},
          "columns": [
            {
              "id": "col-11",
              "columnConfig": {},
              "cells": [
                {
                  "id": "cell-11",
                  "cellConfig": {},
                  "widgets": [
                    {
                      "id": "widg-11",
                      "viz": {
                        "appId": "other.package_cards.forecast.app",
                        "vizId": "other.package_cards.forecast.viz" 
                      }
                    },
                    {
                      "id": "widg-12",
                      "viz": {
                        "appId": "applocalprovider",
                        "vizId": "applocalprovider-display"
                      }
                    }
                  ]
                }
              ]
            }
          ]
        }
      ]
    },
    "texts": [
      {
        "locale": "",
        "textDictionary": {
          "Title": "User Page"
        }
      }
    ]
  },

entry.title: Combining apps/cards from multiple Content Providers/Packages in one CDM (Common Data Model)
entry.content:
Dear experts in this space and dear broader SAP community, 

I am trying to combine apps from different Work Zone Content Providers/Packages in one CDM (Common Data Model) definition of another Content Provider. Example - One Content Package/Provider is providing some cards/apps to my Work Zone tenant, and I would like to consume these cards/apps in a Work Space CDM definition of another Content Provider. 

Similar things can be done using the Work Zone Content Manager allowing to combine apps/cards from different Content Providers/Packages into one Work Page. Nevertheless, I couldn't figure out how to do this within a CDM definition. Prefixing the app ID with the other Content Provider ID (see below) did not do the job (e.g., content.provider_app.id). Any help or input is highly appreciated. 

My goal is to have a CDM, that contains a Work Page, that references apps from multiple other Content Packages/Providers. 

@matthias_schmalz @gregorw @jmargieh - Maybe you have already done something similar?

Thanks in advance and all the best, 
Martin

 

{
    "_version": "3.2.0",
    "identification": {
      "id": "combined-workpage",
      "entityType": "workpage",
      "title": "{{Title}}"
    },
    "payload": {
      "workpageConfig": {
        "title": "Combined Work Page"
      },
      "rows": [
        {
          "id": "row-1",
          "rowConfig": {},
          "columns": [
            {
              "id": "col-11",
              "columnConfig": {},
              "cells": [
                {
                  "id": "cell-11",
                  "cellConfig": {},
                  "widgets": [
                    {
                      "id": "widg-11",
                      "viz": {
                        "appId": "other.package_cards.forecast.app",
                        "vizId": "other.package_cards.forecast.viz" 
                      }
                    },
                    {
                      "id": "widg-12",
                      "viz": {
                        "appId": "applocalprovider",
                        "vizId": "applocalprovider-display"
                      }
                    }
                  ]
                }
              ]
            }
          ]
        }
      ]
    },
    "texts": [
      {
        "locale": "",
        "textDictionary": {
          "Title": "User Page"
        }
      }
    ]
  },
